tasks.task: Making a cooling herbal body and facial spray using fresh herbs
subtasks: Collecting herbs, flowers, and weeds from the garden
Setting up a steam distiller with a deep pot, lid, and oven-safe dishes
Adding herbs and distilled water to the pot
Covering herbs with distilled water (about 2-3 inches)
Sterilizing all equipment with rubbing alcohol
Placing a container upside down in the pot to catch steam
Simmering the mixture on low heat and adding hot water as needed
Collecting the condensate from the lid into the container (replacing ice regularly)
Steeping for 30 minutes to an hour
Pouring off the hydrosol and storing it in a refrigerated, dark glass bottle
Using the hydrosol as a body spray, facial toner, or for other applications
